result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario R. Pena was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.

No contact with victim unless approved by agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  

SAFE Intake Program and follow through.  

AODA and follow through.  

DNA sample.  

60, 90 and 100 day review hearings.
Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

records.addlTxt: Probation review hearing on November 18, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 3:43 pm. 
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears from MCJ and with Attorney Kat Yanke.  

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
AMEND Ct.1 to remove Domestic Abuse Repeater Enhancer. 
DRI Ct.2(Possession of Methamphetamine). 
DRI Ct.4(Possess Drug Paraphernalia).

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
Ct.1(DC-Domestic Abuse Repeater/Domestic Abuse)>>NO CONTEST. 
Ct.3(Possession of Cocaine/Coca)>>NO CONTEST.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation; CONDITIONS: I/S 30 days MCJ for rule violations.  I/S 30 hours community service for rule violations. Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. SAFE Intake Program and follow through.  AODA and follow through.  No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  Pay CC/DV surcharge.  Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample.  60, 90 and 100 day review hearings.  

COURT grants 113 days credit. 
PRH set for 11/18 at 1:15 pm. 

Adj: 3:55 pm.
Plea hearing on August 31, 2022 at 03:20 pm.

ADA Cody Marschall appears in person; Atty Yanke appears in person

Plea Hearing 8/31 @ 3:20 pm

No contact with victim(s):  E.A.F.  (NON-WAIVEABLE)  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Third party child exchange through family resource center.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  No drug paraphernalia.    Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
